biblinkcreator

Class DataLinker

  • java.lang.Object
    • biblinkcreator.DataLinker

  • public class DataLinker
extends java.lang.Object
    A mechanism that links bibliographic data retrieved from semantic repositories.

    Author: David Nazarian

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DataLinker(DataStructure.RepositoryInfo destRepositoryInfo, Logger logger) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Closes the connection to the destination repository where the created links will be saved and source data will be retrieved from.

      Exports the created links into a specified file in N-Triples format based on the name of the link source repository.

      Exports the created links into a specified file in N-Triples format based on the names of the link source and destination repository and the type of the identifier involved in the link creation.

      Exports the created links into a specified file in N-Triples format based on the names of the link source and destination repository.

      Links data retrieved from two sources (named graphs) based on a category-A identifier (as defined in the Identifier class), a title and a year (if exists).

      • DataLinker

        public DataLinker(DataStructure.RepositoryInfo destRepositoryInfo,
                  Logger logger)
        Parameters:
        destRepositoryInfo - Information about the destination repository where the created links will be saved and source data will be retrieved from.
        logger - A logger that will log generated messages.

    • Method Detail

      • getLinkMessageRecords

        public int getLinkMessageRecords()
        Returns:
        The number of created links needed for a message to be logged during the link creation.

      • setLinkMessageRecords

        public void setLinkMessageRecords(int linkMessageRecords)
        Parameters:
        linkMessageRecords - The number of created links needed for a message to be logged during the link creation.

        Returns:

        Parameters:

      • getInsertBatchSize

        public int getInsertBatchSize()
        Returns:
        The number of created links to be batch inserted.

      • setInsertBatchSize

        public void setInsertBatchSize(int insertBatchSize)
        Parameters:
        insertBatchSize - The number of created links to be batch inserted.

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes the connection to the destination repository where the created links will be saved and source data will be retrieved from.

      • linkData

        public int linkData(java.lang.String linkSourceARepositoryName,
                    java.lang.String linkSourceBRepositoryName,
                    java.lang.String linkTypeURIString,
                    boolean resolveDOI,
                    Identifier.CategoryAIdentifierType categoryAIdentifierType,
                    DataStructure.CategoryAToleranceData categoryAToleranceData,
                    DataStructure.StringSimilaritySelector similaritySelector)
        Links data retrieved from two sources (named graphs) based on a category-A identifier (as defined in the Identifier class), a title and a year (if exists).
        Parameters:
        linkSourceARepositoryName - The name (alias) of the repository which will be used to retrieve data from the named graph containing the link source data.
        linkSourceBRepositoryName - The name (alias) of the repository which will be used to retrieve data from the named graph containing the link destination data.
        linkTypeURIString - The URI string of the predicate which will be used to link a subject URI to an object URI.
        resolveDOI - Determines if doi.org URL resolving will take place.
        categoryAIdentifierType - The type of category-A identifier to be used for the data retrieval from the two named graphs.
        categoryAToleranceData - Data comparison tolerance parameters.
        similaritySelector - The parameterized string similarity measure to be used.
        Returns:
        The number of links created and saved.

      • linkData

        public int linkData(java.lang.String linkSourceARepositoryName,
                    java.lang.String linkSourceBRepositoryName,
                    java.lang.String linkTypeURIString,
                    boolean resolveDOI,
                    Identifier.CategoryBIdentifierType categoryBIdentifierType,
                    DataStructure.CategoryBToleranceData categoryBToleranceData,
                    DataStructure.StringSimilaritySelector similaritySelector)
        Links data retrieved from two sources (named graphs) based on a category-B identifier (as defined in the Identifier class), a title and a year.
        Parameters:
        linkSourceARepositoryName - The name (alias) of the repository which will be used to retrieve data from the named graph containing the link source data.
        linkSourceBRepositoryName - The name (alias) of the repository which will be used to retrieve data from the named graph containing the link destination data.
        linkTypeURIString - The URI string of the predicate which will be used to link a subject URI to an object URI.
        resolveDOI - Determines if doi.org URL resolving will take place.
        categoryBIdentifierType - The type of category-B identifier to be used for the data retrieval from the two named graphs.
        categoryBToleranceData - Data comparison tolerance parameters.
        similaritySelector - The parameterized string similarity measure to be used.
        Returns:
        The number of links created and saved.

      • exportLinks

        public void exportLinks(java.lang.String linkSourceARepositoryName,
                        java.lang.String linkSourceBRepositoryName,
                        Identifier.IdentifierType identifierType,
                        java.lang.String exportPathName)
        Exports the created links into a specified file in N-Triples format based on the names of the link source and destination repository and the type of the identifier involved in the link creation.
        Parameters:
        linkSourceARepositoryName - The name (alias) of the repository which will be used to retrieve data from the named graph containing the link source data.
        linkSourceBRepositoryName - The name (alias) of the repository which will be used to retrieve data from the named graph containing the link destination data.
        identifierType - The type of the identifier used to create the links.
        exportPathName - The path (including the filename) where the exported links will be saved.

      • exportLinks

        public void exportLinks(java.lang.String linkSourceARepositoryName,
                        java.lang.String linkSourceBRepositoryName,
                        java.lang.String exportPathName)
        Exports the created links into a specified file in N-Triples format based on the names of the link source and destination repository.
        Parameters:
        linkSourceARepositoryName - The name (alias) of the repository which will be used to retrieve data from the named graph containing the link source data.
        linkSourceBRepositoryName - The name (alias) of the repository which will be used to retrieve data from the named graph containing the link destination data.
        exportPathName - The path (including the filename) where the exported links will be saved.

      • exportLinks

        public void exportLinks(java.lang.String linkSourceARepositoryName,
                        java.lang.String exportPathName)
        Exports the created links into a specified file in N-Triples format based on the name of the link source repository.
        Parameters:
        linkSourceARepositoryName - The name (alias) of the repository which will be used to retrieve data from the named graph containing the link source data.
        exportPathName - The path (including the filename) where the exported links will be saved.

      • subjectURIsMustBeRejected

        public boolean subjectURIsMustBeRejected(java.lang.String subjectURIStringA,
                                         java.lang.String subjectURIStringB,
                                         boolean resolveDOI)
        Checks if the provided subject URI strings must be rejected from the link creation because of similarity.
        Parameters:
        subjectURIStringA - A subject URI string.
        subjectURIStringB - A subject URI string.
        resolveDOI - Determines if doi.org URL resolving will be involved.
        Returns:
        A value indicating if the two subject URI strings must be rejected from the link creation because of similarity.
